cont.entity_a: Heats the room well and fits perfectly as per the stated measurements. Offers a lot of heat and is energy efficient. Heaters work well for bathrooms. Units heat up quickly and quietly.
cont.entity_b: Provides good heat for a small bathroom. Slight improvement over previous version, with better heat output. Good replacement for an old model, heats well and fits existing setup. Not suitable for very cold climates, takes time to heat up. Heater has a solid element that provides good heat output.

cont.entity_a: Installation instructions are clear and easy to read. The heater should be attached to wall studs, and pre-drilling is recommended due to ineffective pre-stamped screw holes.
cont.entity_b: Model 157 heater has a straightforward installation process. Installation can be difficult due to poor design placement of screw holes. Mounting screws can be difficult to install.

cont.entity_a: Failed after just over 4 years, which is considered short. Concerns about durability as multiple units failed in under two years. Purchased unit failed within a few months.
cont.entity_b: New units failed during initial tests after installation. Replacements were necessary due to product failures. Solid heating element is more durable than older wire coil versions.
Quieter and more efficient than older models. Fan noise can be an issue, but newer models are quieter.

cont.entity_a: Good customer service with efficient replacement process.
cont.entity_b: Efficient customer service with hassle-free replacements.

cont.entity_a: Heaters are generally safe around young children and pets.
Factory handling and packing could be improved to prevent slight damage.
cont.entity_b: Ceiling heaters are cheaply made and produce minimal heat. Heater works well but is not aesthetically pleasing.

cont.entity_a: Well made, but quality control issues noted.
